text: The most important function of commerce is in?

options.B: helping people to improve their profits
options.C: facilitating exchange among individuals and firms
options.D: assisting trade through banking and insurance

explanation: commerce plays an important role in the distribution of goods. It makes available to the users goods produced in different parts of a country as well as from other countries.

text: The three main classification of occupation are?
explanation: occupations can be classified into three categories:- Industry- Commerce- Service,

text: An oil exploration company is engaged in?
explanation: A primary or extractive occupation is occupations concerned with the production of primary products or products that are extracted from nature. Examples of Extractive occupation: farmer, fishing, mining, oil exploration etc

text: Service rendered to the public is provided by?
explanation: civil servants  are people working in the public sector. An employee of the civil service is basically employed by the government to impartially implement their policies and laws. As a result, civil service employees often work in areas that highly affect people's everyday life (e.g. health and education).

text: The creation of goods and services to satisfy human wants is referred to as?
explanation: Production is the organised activity of transforming resources into finished products in the form of goods and services

text: Resources obtained from the extractive sector that are transformed into finished products are examples of?
explanation: primary production is the production of raw materials for industry.

text: Which of the following is a limitation of division of labour?
explanation: click here

text: An individual that links the producer with the retailer is?
explanation: A wholesaler is a person or company that sells goods in large quantities at low prices, typically to retailers. He is the link between the producer and the retailer, ie he buys from the producer and sells to the retailer

text: One of the functions of a retailer is the?

options.B: provision of credit facilities to relations

explanation: FunctionsofRetailers:- Breaking the Bulk (buying in large quantities and selling in bits to the consumer)-  Storing, Stocks Multiple Brands- Customer Education- Online Services and Other Details.

text: The main frame of selling directly to the consumers by manufacturers is to?
explanation: Direct selling allows you to further reinforce MSRP (manufacturer's suggested retail price) and communicate directly with consumers about price points. Selling direct allows you to collect a goldmine of data. Better customer data leads to better promotions, better products, better relationships and more sales.

text: Balance of payment problems arise if a country's?

options.D: invisible exports is more than visible exports

explanation: A country's balance of payment problems  arises when the value of its visible and invisible imports is greater than the value of exports

text: The three components of a country's balance of payments are?

options.A: current account, capital account and monetary movement account
options.B: capital account, trade account and business record
options.C: sales account, profit and loss account  and capital account
options.D: monetary movement account, trade account and sales ledger

explanation: The three components of the balance of payments are the current account, financial account, and capital account.

text: A document that indicates obligation that is transferable by delivery and endorsement is a?
explanation: click here

text: The document which can be exchange for a bill of lading is?
explanation: Freight note is an invoice from a shipowner to a shipper showing the amount of freight due on a shipment of goods. It can be use in place of a bill of lading

text: The price quoted which includes the cost of insurance, freight and all delivery charges to the importer's warehouse is?
explanation: Free On Board, in short FOB, is a term frequently used in shipping terms where the seller quotes a price including the cost of delivering goods to the nearest port.  In simple terms, FOB price means the buyer has to bear the shipping costs completely.

text: The purchase of goods under the CWO system of payment implies that?

options.A: money must be enclosed when ordering
options.B: payment must be made on delivery
options.C: payment must be made within few days
options.D: cash must be paid on the spot

explanation: Cash With Order (CWO): A payment term whereby the buyer remits the money at the time the order is placed.

text: The most effective nut limited medium of advertising in Nigeria is?
explanation: click here

text: A cheque that has been drawn but not presented for payment can still be honored?
explanation: Personal cheques are valid for six months from the date of issue after which they become stale. Unlike personal cheques, bank cheques do not go stale after six months.

text: The major source of income to commercial banks is?
explanation: Bankinghas to do with engaging in the business of keeping money for savings and checking accounts or for exchange or for issuing loans and credit etc. it consist of transacting business with a bank; depositing or withdrawing funds or requesting a loan etc. in another aspect, it is the legal right of a bank to seize deposited funds to cover a loan that is in default.

text: Mr. Lawal insured his warehouse against burglary but it was later gutted  by fire. this implies that?

options.A: the loss should be borne by the insurer
options.B: Mr. Lawal is liable only for half of the estimated loss
options.C: the insurer should make a consolation payment for the loss
options.D: the loss should be borne by Mr. Lawal

explanation: click here

text: The agreement of insurers to spread risks among themselves is a major feature of?
explanation: Reinsuranceis the practice whereby insurers transfer portions of their risk portfolios to other parties by some form of agreement to reduce the likelihood of paying a large obligation resulting from an insurance claim.

text: Inbound tourism occurs when?

options.A: non-residents  of a country travel to other countries
options.B: resident of a country travel to another country
options.C: non-resident of a country travel within it
options.D: resident of a country travel within it

explanation: Inbound tourismis when a person from his/her home country travels to another country for not less than 24 hours and not more than few months. The purpose of the travel is mostly leisure and very seldom for business.

text: One of the major disadvantages of pipeline transportation is its?
explanation: click here

text: The business organization that can effectively combine management with control is?
explanation: Asole proprietorship, also known as thesoletrader, individual entrepreneurship orproprietorship, is a type of enterprise that is owned and run by one person and in which there is no legal distinction between the owner and the business entity. The business owner manages and controls all business activities

text: When two or more companies agree to execute a project too large for one to handle, this is referred to as?
explanation: Aconsortiumis a group made up of two or more individuals, companies, or governments that work together to achieving a common objective.

text: In the event of voluntary liquidation, the appointed of a liquidator is the responsibility of the?
explanation: What is a Liquidator? A liquidator or an official receiver manages the entire liquidation process. He or she is appointed when a company goes into liquidation or is wound up by the Court in a compulsory liquidation process, which is brought about by a disgruntled creditor. In a voluntary liquidation, the board of directors appoint a liquidator

text: A source of business financing which involves pledging of a specific assets is?
explanation: A mortgage is a loan in which property or real estate is used as collateral. The borrower enters into an agreement with the lender (usually a bank) wherein the borrower receives cash upfront then makes payments over a set time span until he pays back the lender in full.

text: An example of a trade association is?
explanation: click here

text: A broker is an agent who links a potential investor with?

options.A: a shareholder who wants to register a company
options.B: other members of the exchange who want to trade

explanation: A stockbroker is a professional who executes buy and sell orders for stocks and other securities on behalf of clients.

text: Second-tier Securities Market differ from the First-tier Securities Market in that the former is?
explanation:
The First Tier Securities Market provides a forum for buying and selling of shares of companies in the market. The First-Tier markets are for well established large scale. companies.
A second-tier security market is a market where securities of companies that cannot be traded in the first-tier security market are quoted. It is for smaller companies which are unable to meet the requirements for listing on the more stringent segment (main market) of the Exchange

text: A communication process providing information for decision-making in an organization is the?
explanation: click here

text: The managerial ability of a supervisor in an organization may be underutilized if the?

options.A: morale of the supervised is high
options.D: morale of thr supervisor is low

explanation: click here

text: The arrangement and interrelationship of the various components and positions of a business is referred to as?
explanation: An organizational structure is a system that outlines how certain activities are directed in order to achieve the goals of anorganization. These activities can include rules, roles, and responsibilities. Theorganizational structurealso determines how information flows between levels within the company.

text: The variety of goods and services which a company offers for sale is its?
explanation: Product mix, also known as product assortment, refers to the total number of product lines a company offers to its customers.

text: Activities undertaken to create awareness for goods by conducting contest is?
explanation: Sales promotionis the process of persuading a potential customer to buy the product. Examples include contests, coupons, freebies, loss leaders, point of purchase displays, premiums, prizes, product samples, and rebates.

text: The slogan, a wonderful world, used by a communication network is a form of?
explanation: persuasive advertising: A type of product promotion that attempts to influence a consumer in favor of a purchasing particular good or service.

text: To make a simple contract valid, the intention must be?
explanation: A valid contract is a written or expressed agreement between two parties to provide a product or service.  The contact must be legal and binding on the contracting parties for it to be valid

text: The major parties to an agency relationship are the?
One of the obligations of an employer to an employee is to?

options.A: indemnify him against liabilities incurred on duty
options.C: terminate his appointment without prior notice
options.D: indemnity himagainst injuries caused through negligence

explanation: click here

text: The body charged with the responsibility of regulating foods and drugs in Nigeria is the?
explanation: The Standard Organisation of Nigeria (SON) is the sole statutory body that is vested with the responsibility of standardising and regulating the quality of all products in Nigeria.

text: The physical components of a computer system refers to the?
An example of a computer operating system is?
explanation: ExamplesofOperating SystemsSomeexamplesinclude versions of Microsoft Windows (like Windows 10, Windows 8, Windows 7, Windows Vista, and Windows XP), Apple's macOS (formerlyOSX), ChromeOS, BlackBerry TabletOS, and flavors of Linux, an open sourceoperating system.

text: Intranet differs from extranet in that the former?

options.A: requires a modem before it could be used
options.B: can generally be accessed by the public
options.C: is restricted to employees of an organization

explanation:
An intranet is a private network, operated by a large company or other organisation, which uses internet technologies, but is insulated from the global internet. An extranet is an intranet that is accessible to some people from outside the company, or possibly shared by more than one organisation.
The major difference from an extranet, however, is that an intranet is used internally. While an extranet allows businesses to communicate with clients and vendors, an intranet allows employees and colleagues to work together in a virtual space — no outside parties are involved.

text: A predominant make-up language for web pages is the?
explanation: HTTP means HyperText Transfer Protocol. HTTP is the underlying protocol used by the World Wide Web and this protocol defines how messages are formatted and transmitted, and what actions Web servers and browsers should take in response to various commands.

text: A software application that enables a user to display and interact with texts, images and videos is the?
explanation: A web browser is a software program that allows a user to locate, access and display web pages which can be in form of texts, images, and videos

text: The symbol at in an internet mail address is used to?

options.A: seperate the user name from the machine name
options.B: link the user with other Internet users
options.C: locate the addresses of Internet users
options.D: link the user with the machine

explanation: click here

text: A business organization is said to be socially responsible when it?

options.A: gets involved in issues relating to the society
options.B: rewards its staff for long-term service
options.D: invites the public to its annual general meetings

explanation: Social responsibilitymeans that individuals and companies have a duty to act in the best interests of their environment and society as a whole.

text: Resources obtained from the extractive sector that are transformed into finished products are examples of
explanation: primary production;the production of raw materials for industry.
